humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, one out of two sentinel lymph nodes is positive with multiple metastases, the largest measuring 3.5 mm in greatest dimension. This indicates that the patient has metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes, which corresponds to N1 based on the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text:
The N stage for axillary lymph node involvement in the 7th edition of the AJCC staging system is as follows: 
NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed 
N0: No regional lymph node metastasis 
N1: Metastasis in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes and/or in infraclavicular lymph nodes 
N2: Metastasis in 4-9 axillary lymph nodes, and/or in clinically apparent ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastasis 
N3: Metastasis in 10 or more axillary lymph nodes, or in clinically apparent ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes in the presence of positive axillary lymph nodes. 
In this report, the patient has 1 out of 2 sentinel lymph nodes positive with multiple (5) metastases, the largest measuring 3.5 mm in greatest dimension. Extranodal extension is focally present. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.
